file_content.text: It is always a pleasure to see you again. I wish I had time to speak, but matters of state cannot wait.
So good to see you all again. It is always a pleasure to serve Senator Kayl's esteemed friends.
How lovely to see you again. Any friend of Senator Kayl's is a friend of mine.
That will be all, Minister. Dismissed.
Captain Winborn contacted me. You thwarted an attack that would've killed thousands. You have my gratitude.
Unfortunately, you also have a holorecording I would like destroyed. Its contents will only cause harm.
You committed a crime, Senator. Do you really expect to get away with it?
You dealt with gangsters.
There's so much you don't understand about the situation. The Jedi Order left us to rebuild Coruscant alone.
Do you know how many lives have been lost because of your deception, Senator?
You withheld the truth.
I thought the only life I risked was my own. I expected assassination attempts, not war.
You've been lying to everyone, Senator. The only reason those gangsters attacked us was to get at you.
This attack was your fault.
I understand your anger, Lieutenant. But you need to understand--things here are complicated.
I don't expect much from my elected officials, but taking credits from gangsters? Seriously?
You've been a bad Senator.
Many choices only appear foolish in retrospect. At the time, it felt like the right thing to do.
Did your security chief spoil the big surprise?
Captain Winborn told you?
The Migrant Merchants' Guild warned me. They're courting my favor as if bargaining were still an option. It never was.
How much is your reputation worth to you?
Everything is negotiable.
Despite what you must think, I'm not wealthy. Everything I've earned has been invested in Coruscant.
My opponent in the elections was a vile man: lazy, stupid and corrupt. He wasn't interested in building, only taking. I had to win.
But I didn't possess as much wealth as he did. When those gangsters approached me, I accepted their "donation"--and I'd do it again.
Do you hear yourself? After everything that's happened, you still won't admit to being wrong.
You've learned nothing.
I'm not wrong. If you'd witnessed the suffering on this world--the poverty and despair--you'd know that.
The people choose their leaders by popular vote. What difference did it make how many credits you had?
Why was wealth important?
Don't be naive. Wealth can purchase influence--and influence sways popular opinion. My opponent understood that too well.
There's nothing I wouldn't do to stop my enemies. Sometimes you have to break the rules.
I don't blame you at all.
I regret nothing, but I've worked hard to atone for my compromises.
I stole from those criminals to rebuild Coruscant for its people. Set things right. I'll bring the Migrant Merchants' Guild to justice.
You hold the power to ensure my success. Let me finish healing this world. Please destroy that recording.
If you really love the people of Coruscant, you'll admit what you've done. Let them decide whether or not to forgive you.
No, the truth must come out.
You think I'm dishonest? I'm just a realist--but there's no point arguing it with you.
I won't force you to go public. I'll call an emergency meeting in the Senate. Tell them the truth. Let them decide.
Coruscant will be rebuilt, with or without you. I promise to help finish what you've started.
That's for the best.
Perhaps you should run for office.
I'll hang onto the proof, just in case you get cold feet about confessing.
I'll keep this recording.
I already made one mistake today.
I hope they send you to prison for a long time. Can't believe I liked you....
You deserve a harsh sentence.
There are many kinds of heroes.
You're all clear, Senator.
All right. [Destroy recording]
Thank you. I won't forget what you've done for me--for Coruscant.
If you need help making this world strong, I'll always be here.
I'll help with the rebuilding.
You're a true friend and patriot.
I'm not sure if I did the right thing. I'm counting on you to convince me.
Don't make me regret this.
I swore to uphold the people's faith when I was elected. That hasn't changed. It won't.
It was my pleasure. I hope we'll continue working closely.
[Flirt] For us?
I promise you won't only hear from me when there's a crisis.
Since you're feeling generous, how about a donation to my favorite cause?
For compensation.
Certainly. Take it in the spirit of friendship--and discretion.
I'll see to it you're properly recognized for your heroism in the old Galactic Market. Farewell.
We haven't heard from Captain Winborn since he and his men entered the old Galactic Market. I hope they're safe.
Ah, at last! One moment, please... Senator? Your special appointment has arrived.
Thank you for coming on short notice. I'm Senator Vanara Kayl. Forgive my abruptness, but time is a luxury I don't possess.
As you may have heard, Coruscant is overwhelmed with refugees fleeing Imperial tyranny. Many have been here since the war.
The refugees took over the old Galactic Market sector, huddling in shops and warehouses that were abandoned during the Sacking of Coruscant. They refuse to leave.
There has to be a better place for these refugees to live.
Sounds bad.
We've offered to resettle them offworld, but they're demanding to remain here.
Is the Republic doing anything to provide for these refugees?
What's being done to help?
Resources are scarce. There's only so much we can do.
They should be thankful. If this were the Empire, they'd be slaves--or worse.
At least they have homes.
I fear their current situation is little better.
As so often happens when fear and poverty dominate, a criminal element has risen to take advantage of the situation.
The Migrant Merchants' Guild began as a political advocacy group for refugees. Over the years, it transformed into a ruthless and murderous criminal syndicate.
As if these people didn't have enough problems, now they're being controlled by gangsters.
The poor refugees.
These criminals exploit the very people their guild allegedly protects. They rule through intimidation and extortion.
Do the gangsters have a power structure? A leader?
Who's in charge of it?
It's a consortium of powerful crime lords. When one falls, another takes his place. It makes them difficult to defeat.
Why haven't you forced all the refugees out? Once they're gone, the gang goes with them.
Just evict them all.
Past attempts to forcibly relocate refugees ended poorly. The criminals helped the people resist, and came away looking like heroes.
The Migrant Merchants' Guild has grown increasingly hostile and violent. Their criminal enforcers have acquired military-grade weaponry.
Earlier today, their thugs took to the streets. They attacked our security personnel, set fires, began rioting. We're facing an armed insurrection.
With all due respect, Senator, are you sure this requires Jedi intervention?
Jedi aren't police officers.
Your order has been away from Coruscant too long. It's time the Jedi took a direct hand in protecting the Republic capital.
I've negotiated with hostile parties before. Put me in touch with these criminals. I'll do what I can.
Diplomacy is my specialty.
Jedi are warriors as well as diplomats. If diplomacy fails, we must use force.
You just described the last enemy I fought.
Sounds like Ord Mantell.
I need your expertise, Lieutenant. We can't rule out the possibility of Imperial influence.
I don't know what you've heard about me, but I've got nothing to do with criminal activity--promise.
Not sure why we're talking.
I'm told you're very good at dealing with armed insurgents. That's my interest in you, Captain.
Have these gangsters made any demands?
What do they want?
They only seem intent on destruction.
A battalion or two of the Republic's finest will solve that problem.
Send in your army.
A full-scale military response is out of the question. The collateral damage would be more than we can bear.
For generations, the old Galactic Market was Coruscant's central trade hub. Its importance isn't merely economic--it's a symbol of the Republic's freedom.
The comm channels are jammed. We've lost contact with our security forces. I need your help ending this crisis. The criminals must not win.
I'll focus on saving the people caught in the cross fire. Punishing criminals isn't a Jedi's duty.
I'll do what I can.
I suspect they'll punish themselves by attacking you.
If there's any way to settle this dispute without further violence, I'll find it.
I'll do what I can.
Do not restrain yourself too much. These men are thieves and murderers.
I'll push those gangsters to the bottom of Coruscant, if that's what it takes.
I'll do what I can.
Burying them may be our best option, Lieutenant.
I'm a pretty good shot. Figure I can take at least half these guys by myself.
I'll do what I can.
Considering your accomplishments on Ord Mantell, that's no exaggeration.
You've hired the best, Senator. Just sit back and relax.
They won't.
I can't promise that, but at least I have hope.
You've won me over, Senator. Whatever you need, I'll do my best.
[Flirt] They won't.
I don't doubt it, Master Jedi.
You can count on my absolute commitment, Senator. I won't disappoint you.
[Flirt] They won't.
I look forward to your return, Master Jedi.
It'll be my pleasure, Senator. You've inspired me.
[Flirt] They won't.
The feeling's mutual, Lieutenant.
Leave everything to me, gorgeous. When the bad guys are all gone, I'll take you out for dinner.
[Flirt] They won't.
That's a generous offer. We'll discuss it later.
If the situation's as bad as you say, your people didn't survive.
Your forces are probably dead.
There's still hope. If my security forces were dead, those gangsters couldn't resist letting me know.
Do whatever you must to save innocent lives from that criminal filth. Find my security chief, Captain Winborn. He'll help. Good luck.
Yes, you'll have to make an appointment. No, I don't know where the administrator is. Now excuse me....
